context: The Honours Bachelor of Interpretation (American Sign Language English) program at George Brown College requires applicants to go through a screening of their English and ASL skills. The screening sessions are held in person on campus. Applicants are preferred, but not required, to bring a reference letter. Contact information for the screening session coordinators is Corene Kennedy at ckennedy@georgebrown.ca and Rhonnda Reynolds at rreynolds@georgebrown.ca. The phone numbers for general inquiries are 416-415-2000 and TTY: 1-877-515-5559. For more information, applicants can email ask.george@georgebrown.ca or visit the college's social media hub. The information on the website is subject to change without notice. Applicants are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.
question:
Title: Application Process for Honours Bachelor of Interpretation (ASL-English) Program at George Brown College

To apply for the Honours Bachelor of Interpretation (American Sign Language - English) program at George Brown College, applicants are required to go through a screening process that assesses their English and ASL skills. The screening sessions are held in person on campus. Here's how to apply:

1. Contact Corene Kennedy or Rhonnda Reynolds:
   - Corene Kennedy: ckennedy@georgebrown.ca
   - Rhonnda Reynolds: rreynolds@georgebrown.ca
   - For general inquiries: ask.george@georgebrown.ca
   - Phone numbers: 416-415-2000 and TTY: 1-877-515-5559

2. Attend a screening session: The college prefers, but not requires, applicants to bring a reference letter.

3. Check the website for updated information: The information on the George Brown College website is subject to change without notice. Applicants are responsible for verifying fee requirements and other program details.

4. Email or call for more information: If you have any questions, you can email ask.george@georgebrown.ca or visit the college's social media hub.

Contact Information:
- George Brown College: 505 Dundas St W, Toronto, ON M5G 2C3, Canada
- Email: ask.george@georgebrown.ca
- Website: https://www.georgebrown.ca/programs/interpreter/Pages/index.aspx
- Phone: 416-415-2000 and TTY: 1-877-515-5559?
